entry.title: pandas - dateutil.parser import error
entry.content:
Try to run import pandas in python. Encountered this:

{% codeblock lang:python %}

import pandas No module named dateutil.parser Traceback (most recent call last): File “”, line 1, in File “/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.6/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/pandas-0.12.0-py2.7-macosx-10.9-x86_64.egg/pandas/init.py”, line 6, in 

from . import hashtable, tslib, lib

File “tslib.pyx”, line 31, in init pandas.tslib (pandas/tslib.c:48782) ImportError: No module named dateutil.parser

{% endcodeblock %}

Fixed by running

{% codeblock lang:bash %} $ pip install python-dateutil

{% endcodeblock %}

entry.title: brew local modification error and solution
entry.content:
``` $ brew update

   error: Your local changes to the following files would be overwritten by  merge:
    Library/Formula/erlang.rb
  Please, commit your changes or stash them before you can merge.
  Aborting
  Error: Failure while executing: git pull -q origin refs/heads/master:refs/remotes/origin/master

```

Solution

$ cd `brew --prefix` $ cd Cellar/erlang/ $ git reset --hard HEAD

entry.title: To find out where homebrew keeps the files of a formula
entry.content:
â€¦ Simply follow the link.

e.g.

```

ls -l which erl lrwxr-xr-x 1 antkong admin 29 29 Apr 23:49 /usr/local/bin/erl –> ../Cellar/erlang/R16B/bin/erl

```

entry.title: homebrew and erlang R16B
entry.content:
Currently the version of erlang in homebrew is defaulted to version R15B03-1 even though a more recent version, R16B, is available.

To install R16B, it is what I did:
